definition: to whistle past/to hurtle past/to zip by
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: The bullet zipped past my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 子彈從我的肩頭呼嘯而過。

sentences.english: Just then, a whole flight of bombers zoomed over the house.
sentences.chinese: 就在這時，一整隊轟炸機從房子上空呼嘯而過。

sentences.english: They eat crouched in corners or on the street as cars whiz by.
sentences.chinese: 他們蹲在角落裏或在轎車呼嘯而過大街上喫飯。

sentences.english: A muscle car roared down the highway.
sentences.chinese: 一輛肌肉車在高速公路上呼嘯而過。

sentences.english: Two guys were riding down the street in a car. They come to a red light.
sentences.chinese: 兩個男人開車前行，路遇一紅燈，司機呼嘯而過。

sentences.english: The wind screamed over the Gulf and turned the water white.
sentences.chinese: 大風在海灣上空呼嘯而過，把海水吹得白浪翻滾。

sentences.english: Shrapnel zings by, slices my throat.
sentences.chinese: 彈片呼嘯而過，把我的喉嚨割破。

sentences.english: The author was constantly aware of cars and trucks on the road.
sentences.chinese: 筆者在路上經常會遭遇呼嘯而過的大卡車。

sentences.english: Some speedboats can zip around at 80 miles an hour.
sentences.chinese: 有一些快艇可以以每小時80英里的時速呼嘯而過。

sentences.english: The trees bent as the north wind howled through them.
sentences.chinese: 北風呼嘯而過，樹都彎了。

sentences.english: The train thundered by, shaking the house.
sentences.chinese: 列車呼嘯而過，房子都震動起來。
